question.text:
Arrange the following plants in the ascending order of evolution.
Cycads, monocotyledons, dicotyledons, progymnosperms, seed ferns, psilophyton.

options.text: Psilophyton, seed ferns, progymnosperms,cycads, dicotyledons, monocotyledons
Psilophyton, progymnosperms, seed ferns, cycads, dicotyledons, monocotyledons
Psilophyton, progymnosperms, seed ferns,cycads, monocotyledons, dicotyledons
Progymnosperms, psilophyton, seed ferns, cycads, dicotyledons, monocotyledons

solution.text: Psilophyton (genus of extinct vascular plants) <mo>⟶</mo> progymnosperms (extinct group of plants that flourished in the mid to late Devonian (360–350 MYA) and contained the ancestors of modern gymnosperms) <mo>⟶</mo> seed ferns (pteridospermatophyta are several distinct groups of extinct seed plants) ⟶ <mo></mo>cycads (plants typically characterized by a stout and woody trunk with a crown of large, hard and stiff, evergreen leaves) <mo>⟶</mo> Dicotyledons (embryo with two cotyledons) <mo>⟶</mo> monocotyledons (embryo with one cotyledon).
